storyInfo: Lava, Kroos, and Mr. Nothing decide to split up to look for clues that might lead to a breakthrough. Unbeknownst to them, the monsters known as 'Ink Spirits' make another attack.

attributes.content: —The finishing touch is the hardest part. Lady Hsü racked her brains, for all along she had been lacking that final touch.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Lady Hsü dared not be reckless, but ultimately could not find the idea she most took to. Her mind in turmoil, she could only take to the streets to relieve her boredom. There, she so happened to hear a butcher calling out, and in the cage by the butcher's side, there was shut a plump fowlbeast.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: For a long time, Lady Hsü stared at that fowl. Perhaps it knew its death was soon to come, and stupefied, the animal watched the pedestrians pass to and fro, making surprisingly little commotion.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Watching and watching, Lady Hsü couldn't help but begin to imagine herself as that fowlbeast, and deep inside, what it might be thinking.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: All who came and went were other sorts, incomprehensible, and far from the grass and riverbanks, in this wilderness of a culture not its own, it was one and alone.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Fate was long since a foregone discussion, and it could now only seek a monumental release.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: On nothing more than helplessness and apathy, such indescribable feelings—Lady Hsü found herself taking a few steps closer, and the fowlbeast, as if drawn in by that gaze of wild imagination, turned to Lady Hsü.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: In that cosmic instant, there was no need for fierce method, sparse colors, and no need to worry how the noble purchasing a painting felt.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Success and failure, gain and loss. In the eyes of this livestock awaiting slaughter, Lady Hsü found an answer to all of them.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: She paid the money to buy the fowl, kept it in the pond in her garden, and immediately took up her brush to add the finishing touches, the movements coming like a flow, no longer hindered at all.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: On the second day, Lady Hsü finished with ease the court-lady painting, and received high praise from the officials and nobles.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Carrying great strings of gold and silver on the way home, Lady Hsü had all along felt that beyond the finishing touches, some little bit else was missing, and was frustrated as though she had failed.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Only when she opened her gate, and saw that fowl treading water in her pond, did she come to a sudden realization.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: She'd thought she had achieved success, and had long escaped the chopping board, scarcely imagining that she had only changed the pond she was in, and lacked for freedom once again.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: The present Lady Hsü had long advanced past the full-spirited, youthful girl she once was.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Over the decades she had taken up her brush, with fame and fortune both, yet her husband had passed in his prime; now she had to gaze over the looks of others. Who would still come to give her finishing touches, to let her free back into her fields?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: What returned to the Hsü manor that evening was but carriages of gold and silver riches.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: It is said that afterwards, some sighted Lady Hsü at the border of Jiangqi, but regardless, ever since then, the lady painter acclaimed as 'the place where magnificence dwells' was never seen again.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Twenty whole years later, among the powers of Hsi, the City of Dusk, there circulated a painting reputed to be Lady Hsü's final work—her swansong.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Most people thought it a fake. It was incomparable with the works of Lady Hsü in her younger years, and its content was incomprehensible. A great deal of the painting was left blank, depicting only a fowlbeast, its appearance as though dead.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Many evaluators believed that among similar paintings of beasts, quite a few great painters drew the beasts of flight and field, vivid and lifelike, remarkably animate, as though they could emerge from the scroll at any time.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: But this fowlbeast was abnormally stiff, lacking all life, and therefore it was regarded as a fake.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Among Lady Hsü's admirers, there was one named Kuei-yü. He was wise with business when young, and had presently come on hard times, scattering his wealth away, hanging in the balance—his most frustrated moments.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Kuei-yü saw this scroll, saw the fowlbeast's eyes, and it was if lightning had struck him. He returned home half-dreaming, unable to settle for the longest time, and after more than ten days without proper sleep or food, he made up his mind, and gathered himself once again.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: The world's affairs are inconstant.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Perhaps only those in frustration's throes like Kuei-yü could see clearly the implications Lady Hsü had hidden in the eyes of that fowlbeast pale as ashes, the longing without end, and the meaning of that 'beastly prisoner within the painting.'
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Life. Life is no more than this.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: You've gathered a lot of these anecdotes and apocrypha, sir. It really is an eye-opener.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: That said, it seems most are legends about Yan painters?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Indeed. The library in my study is quite abundant, and doesn't lack in handwritten folklore nor tales of the strange, but there's no doubt that a majority of it relates to the outstanding painters in history.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Of course, there are also records of minor characters which, for all sorts of reasons, have been buried in anonymity within the history of Yan.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Though ultimately they were never able to stand out in prominence, they still have graceful glimpses of this world of ours, their writers unknown, neither if they're true or false.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Come to mention it... Miss Lava, your friend's person you're searching for is a painter as well, isn't she?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: If she's a recognized name, perhaps with some small fame somewhere, then I may or may not be able to find some clues.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Uh-huh...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Look well, here is the exit of the village.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Ohh! Under this time of the sky, you'd be utterly blind if you didn't carry a lantern!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Master, dare I ask, have you ventured beyond the village before?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Ho? Did not you all come from outside?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Ahahah, I... I was quite drunk at the time, and when I came to, I found myself lying down already in the guesthouse with my companions.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: I understand. To the west, there sits a Mount Hung-tung. Exit from here, walk some ri along the mountain path, and you will arrive!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: However, strange demons roam Mount Hung-tung all year long. I would advise that one keep a healthy distance!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: B—By demons, you mean those monsters, right? Might you know the true face of those things, dear Master?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: I can only guess the smallest idea. I do not dare to bear false witness. I call those things as 'Ink Spirits.'
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Ink? Ah, because they all fade away as puddles of sewage? Quite the snug analogy. Such is the prowess of a Great Master!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Thou flatter'st me. 'Tis only from my childhood, as my head priest would tell ghost stories of 'sprites and spirits,' which I remember deeply.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: How modest, how modest.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: The local people give the name 'Dusk Ridding' to the days when Ink Spirits invade, and pass all night in vigil, hiding under the shelter of the sun. 'Tis a far cry from the Yan 'Dusk-Ridding Eve' I have heard of...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Might it be that Yan is a country of vast lands, and the customs in every place are their own?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Not at all, not at all. I've never heard of any Dusk Ridding like this at the new year, and needless to say I've never met those Ink Spirits before.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: In my journies, I have only met Ink Spirits some meager times. As it is here at P'o-shan Village...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Well! Then we can count ourselves sorely unlucky... arriving here to immediately see the Ink Spirits attack the village... It's fortunate it didn't last long, or else I might've been finished right here.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: I had believed thou wouldst know all by thy finger-counting divination.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: How would I? Even if I had that capability, it wouldn't—
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: —Hold on, the Ink Spirits you're talking about. Do they usually leave Mount Hung-tung? Could lone Ink Spirits happen to stray near?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: When unoccupied I may stroll about the village, and I have never seen an Ink Spirit approach, save for last time. 'Twas truly a crowd to behold.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: So you mean, if you see one, that means there's a whole gaggle?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: I believe it is most likely so.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Th—Then we'd better be on our ways...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Ho? What does thou mean—ah.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Miss, miss!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Whoa, what's the matter?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: My dada said you're a hero who helped the village, so you've gotta be really strong!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Hmm~ Are heroes all strong people, then?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Aren't they?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Heroes are just willing to help, that's all.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Amazing... ah, look, miss, here's the guesthouse I was talking about!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: It's called the Tsui... Tsui-ch'ing Lou!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Tsui', 'Ch'ing', 'Lou.' Those are some real pretty Yan words. You can read 'em?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Yeah, I can!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Sweet, let's go in and see.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Wow, the guest room has even more light than inside my house!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Not too shabby at all.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Miss, are you gonna stay here? It's great!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: (Furnishings... standard table and chairs... thing that look like words too. They're all clues. Gotta note 'em down...)
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Uhh... hold on a minute...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Wah! I think I just heard—
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: —A bell.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: M—Master, could we perhaps pick up the pace?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: We cannot rush, we cannot rush! I must strike the full twelve!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: But—eek—didn't something just fly past the eaves?!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Still short! The last three times!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I—I'll help!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Hoh... they came twice in one day. Why so frequent?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: 'In one day'... you mean 'in twenty-four hours,' right?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: It really is a pain that daylight and nighttime don't ever switch. If you overslept, you'd end up losing track of time forever, wouldn't you...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Hahaha, sleeping in is no good habit...
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Though I must note how unruffled you are, Miss Lava. Presumably you did not cower when those monsters first appeared to you, either?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: These things happen. And you seem pretty calm yourself.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: See the sun strong above our heads. Those monsters would never make their way here.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Nobody'll get hurt, right?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: If you're slow to escape, I fear they're unavoidable... If you do not lose your life, then you are already very lucky.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Mr. Umbrella-Boiler... I have a suggestion.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: We'll help P'o-shan Village pass the Dusk Ridding safely. Those monsters aren't strong, and we'll give it all we have to ensure the villagers' safety.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I want to wait until P'o-shan Village is safe, and then I'd like you to help us leave, Mr. Umbrella-Boiler.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Leave? Here? That of course is easily done, but... you've only just arrived, Miss. Are you truly willing to endanger yourself for us?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: No problem. Those monsters only look scary. They're not actually that tough.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: —Then let me first thank you, on behalf of all in P'o-shan Village.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: M—My benefactors!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Oho, so thou art the benefactor Lava that Nothing spoke of! Well met, well met. I am Saga, humble servant of the Buddha, from Higashi—
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Now now now, Master, Master, the self-introduction can wait! Those Ink Spirits have plunged straight into the village!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: ...'Mo'... fiend...? 'Liang'... two?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: 'Tis the name I chose for those monsters.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: 'Ink Spirit'... 'Mo-liang', a liang of the ch'ih, mei, wang and liang monsters. Very good. We finally have a unified way to address them.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Those Ink... Ink Spirits aren't much of a threat. You don't need to be so nervous.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Oh! Quite imposing! I approve!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Benefactor, I feel this time might be somewhat different...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What's different?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: They're, well, er, a bit of a... horde?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing
